sentences.en: A private is subordinate to a corporal.
All other considerations are subordinate to our need for steady profits.
sentences.cn: 比起我们需要稳定的利润来说,其他需要考虑的事都是次要的.

sentences.en: All other inventions and discoveries were inconsiderable or at least subordinate.
sentences.cn: 所有其它的发明和发现都显得微不足道,或至少退居次要地位.

sentences.en: Haig tended not to seek guidance from subordinates.
sentences.cn: 黑格不想向下属们寻求指导。

sentences.en: He was both willing and able to subordinate all else to this aim.
sentences.cn: 为了这个目标他愿意并能够把其他一切都放在次要的位置。

sentences.en: In the army colonels are subordinate to major generals.
sentences.cn: 在陆军,上校(军衔)在少将之下.

sentences.en: In the army, lieutenants are subordinate to captains.
sentences.cn: 在陆军中, 中尉是上尉的下级.

sentences.en: It was an art in which words were subordinate to images.
sentences.cn: 这是一种形象胜于语言的艺术。

sentences.en: Neither is subordinate to the other.
Order the subordinate ( troops ) to act immediately!
sentences.cn: 命令所属 ( 部队 ) 立即行动!

sentences.en: Sixty of his subordinate officers followed his example.
sentences.cn: 他的60个下级官员都以他为榜样。

sentences.en: The minority is subordinate to the majority.
The overall corporate strategy will have several subordinate and interrelated strategies.
sentences.cn: 公司的总战略通常有好几个从属的、相互有关的战略.

sentences.en: Their parents typically endeavors to keep them subordinate, conforming, and dependent.
sentences.cn: 他们的父母一般都极力使他们处于附属 、 顺从和依赖的地位.

sentences.en: There are major and minor principles in everything, and the minor principles are all subordinate to the major.
sentences.cn: 事情有大道理,有小道理,一切小道理都归大道理管着.

sentences.en: These aims were subordinate to the main aims of the mission.
sentences.cn: 和这次任务的主要目标相比，这些目标是次要的。

sentences.en: Those in subordinate positions will follow the example set by their superiors.

words.tran_cn: 连接主句和从句的；从属的
表示从属关系的；从属的
投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭
使服从（subordinate的ing形式）；使成为下级

trans.tran_cn: 级别或职位较低的，下级的，次要的，附属的
trans.tran_en: in a less important position than someone else
someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

trans.tran_cn: 使…居下位，使在次级，使服从，使从属
trans.tran_en: to put someone or something in a less important position
